DISCLOSURE_INFO:
{
  "Allegations" : "REGARDING THE 1994 PURCHASE OF A VARIABLE APPRECIABLE LIFE INSURANCE POLICY THE CLIENT ALLEGED MISREPRESENTATION CONCERNING THE ABBREVIATED PAYMENT PLAN. DAMAGES UNSPECIFIED.",
  "Settlement Amount" : "$16,686.02",
  "DisplayAAOLinkIfExists" : "N",
  "arbitrationClaimFiledDetail" : "",
  "arbitrationDocketNumber" : "",
  "Broker Comment" : "COMPLAINT WAS A RESULT OF MY LEAVING MY MANAGEMENT POSITION AT PRUDENTIAL IN 1995.  I TOOK OVER AN AGENCY, OTHERWISE CALLED A DEBIT, WHICH HAD EXISTING CLIENTS.  ONE HAPPENED TO BE THIS CLIENT.  PRUDENTIAL AUTOMATICALLY ASSIGNED YOU AS AGENT OF RECORD ON ANNUAL STATEMENTS FOR LIFE INSURANCE WHEN TO TAKE OVER AN AGENCY.  THE CONTRACT WAS SOLD IN 1994 THROUGH ANOTHER AGENT THAT I NEVER MET.  I NEVER HAD THE OPPORTUNITY TO MEET WITH CLIENT, BUT AS I WAS ASSIGNED THE AGENCY, HE WAS UNDER THE IMPRESSION I WAS HIS ORIGINAL AGENT.  THE COMPLAINT WAS IN AUGUST OF 2002, 5 YEARS AFTER I LEFT PRUDENTIAL.  NEVER HAVING SOLD THE CLIENT OR EVEN MEETING HIM, THE ACCUSATIONS HAD NOTHING TO DO WITH ME WHATSOEVER.  PRUDENTIAL IN THE MID 90'S, WAS GOING THROUGH A REMEDIATION PROCESS WHERE THEY WERE REQUIRED TO BE PROACTIVE IN SEEKING OUT DISSATISFIED CLIENTS.  ONCE THEY ENTERED INTO THE REMEDIATION PROGRAM, THE CLIENTS WERE NO LONGER ALLOWED TO BE CONTACTED BY THE AGENT.  WITH THAT SAID, PRUDENTIAL JUST RETURNED THE CLIENT FUNDS WITH LITTLE OR NO INPUT FROM AGENT TO AVOID REGULATORY ISSUES."
}

{
  "Allegations" : "REGARDING THE 1993 PURCHASE OF A VARIABLE LIFE INSURANCE POLICY, THE CLIENT ALLEGED MISREPRESENTATION CONCERNING FAILURE TO DISCLOSE POLICY CHARGES. THE INSURED DID NOT ALLEGE ANY SPECIFIED DAMAGES, HOWEVER, THE COMPANY'S GOOD FAITH DETERMINATION ESTIMATES THEM TO BE APPROXIMATELY $148,305.21.",
  "Damage Amount Requested" : "$148,305.21",
  "Settlement Amount" : "$202,477.31",
  "DisplayAAOLinkIfExists" : "N",
  "arbitrationClaimFiledDetail" : "",
  "arbitrationDocketNumber" : "",
  "Broker Comment" : "CLIENT WAS A CUSTOMER OF ANOTHER AGENT IN MY OFFICE.  I MET CLIENT ONCE WITH OTHER AGENT IN 1993 AFTER THE POLICY HAD BEEN ISSUED BY HIM.  HE ASKED ME TO COME ALONG TO HELP HIM PLACE THE CONTRACT.  SHORTLY THEREAFTER THE AGENT WAS TRANSFERRED OFF MY STAFF.  AGENT WAS RESPONSIBLE FOR SERVICE TO THE CLIENT AND PORTFOLIO RECOMMENDATIONS. NINE YEARS LATER THE COMPLAINT CAME IN.  MY ONLY INVOLVEMENT WAS ONE HOUR OF TIME TO ASSIST THE AGENT.  I HAD NO INVOLVEMENT WITH THE AGENT OR THE CLIENT AFTER HE LEFT MY OFFICE.  THERE WAS NO WAY OF KNOWING THAT THE CLIENT WAS DISSATISFIED OR WHAT THE AGENT WAS TELLING THE CLIENT. PRUDENTIAL IN THE MID 90'S, WAS GOING THROUGH A REMEDIATION PROCESS WHERE THEY WERE REQUIRED TO BE PROACTIVE IN SEEKING OUT DISSATISFIED CLIENTS.  ONCE THEY ENTERED INTO THE REMEDIATION PROGRAM, THE CLIENTS WERE NO LONGER ALLOWED TO BE CONTACTED BY THE AGENT.  WITH THAT SAID, PRUDENTIAL JUST RETURNED THE CLIENT FUNDS WITH LITTLE OR NO INPUT FROM AGENT TO AVOID REGULATORY ISSUES."
}

{
  "Allegations" : "REGARDING THE 1983 PURCHASE OF FOUR VARIABLE APPRECIABLE LIFE (VAL) INSURANCE POLICIES. THE CLIENT'S ALLEGE MISREPRESENTATION WITH REGARD TO THE FUNDING PROPOSAL. NO COMPENSATORY WERE ALLEGED.",
  "Settlement Amount" : "$34,165.01",
  "DisplayAAOLinkIfExists" : "N",
  "arbitrationClaimFiledDetail" : "",
  "arbitrationDocketNumber" : "",
  "Broker Comment" : "THE COMPANY WILL RESCIND THE VAL POLICIES (ESTIMATED SETTLEMENT COST: $34,165.01 [OTHER FIRM EMPLOYEE] WAS THE AGENT & I WAS THE SALES MANAGER. THE [CUSTOMERS] WERE REFERRALS TO AGENT [OTHER FIRM EMPLOYEE] WHO HANDLED THIS WIFE'S PARENTS INSURANCE . THEY INHERITED 68,000 & AGENT [OTHER FIRM EMPLOYEE] SERVICED THE AMOUNT. AFTER A FACT FINDER WAS COMPLETED WE RECOMMENDED 2 OVERFUNDED 500,000 POLICIES. USING A CONSERVATIVE RETURN,I REFLECTED NO NEED FOR ADDITIONAL PREMIUM. IT SEEMS THAT THE AGENT'S NAME IS NEVER MENTIONED IN THE COMPLAINT WHEN IN FACT HE HAD THE MOST CONTACT AND WAS CLOSE TO THE FAMILY. THEY WITHDRAW MONEY SEVERAL TIMES IN THE SECOND YEAR WHICH INDICATES THAT THEY WANTED THE MONEY INSTEAD OF FUTURE BENEFIT. THIS PUT THE POLICIES IN JEOPARDY."
}

{
  "Allegations" : "REGARDING 1993 PURCHASE OF TWO VARIABLE APPRECIABLE LIFE (VAL) INSURANCE POLICIES,THE CLIENT'S ALLEGE MISREPRESENTATION WITH REGARD TO THE FUNDING PROPOSAL. NO COMPENSATORY DAMAGES WERE ALLEGED.",
  "Settlement Amount" : "$11,483.40",
  "DisplayAAOLinkIfExists" : "N",
  "arbitrationClaimFiledDetail" : "",
  "arbitrationDocketNumber" : "",
  "Broker Comment" : "THE COMPANY WILL RESCIND THE VAL POLICIES (ESTIMATES SETTLEMENT COST $11,483.40 I WAS NOT THE REP BUT THE SALES MGR THE REPRESENTATIVE IS NO LONGER WITH PRUDENTIAL & LOFT NO FILES ON THIS CASE. THE [CUSTOMERS] WERE REFERRED TO REPRESENTATIVE [BROKER] FROM PRUDENTIAL SECURITIES. THEY WERE CONCERNED THAT [SPOUSE] HAS WELL OVER $600,000 OF INS. & [CUSTOMER] HAD ONLY 50,000,500,000 OF THE INS. ON [SPOUSE] WAS AN EMPLOYER PAID POLICY WHICH SH E FELFT THAT THE EMPLOYER WAS GOINGT OT STOP FUNDING. [SPOUSE] WANTED TO HAVE LESS INS. ON HER HERSELF & MORE ON HER HUSBAND. SHE ALSO WANTED TO USE THE VALUE OF THE OTHER POLICY. (SHE HAD ALREADY DISCUSSED THIS WITH AN AGENT IN NY) WHILE I CANNOT REMEMBER NO ACCESS TO THE ORIGINAL NUMBER, THE COMPUTER AT THE TIME INDICATED THAT THE FUNDING FROM THE ORIGINAL WAS SUFF ICIENT TO ACCOMPLISH THE [CUSTOMER] REQUEST,AGAIN,THE [CUSTOMERS] INITIATED THE CONVERSATION WTH THE DISCUSSION WITH AGT. IN NY. ONCE THE CONTRACTS WERE WRITTEN I HAD NO MORE INVOLVEMENT."
}

{
  "Allegations" : "REGARDING HIS PURCHASE OF A VARIABLE APPRECIABLE LIFE (VAL)CONTRACT IN 1993, THE CLIENT ALLEGED, I AM REQUESTING PRUDENTIAL INSURANCE C. TO RETURN ANY INVESTMENT OF $50,OOO.OO PLUS INTEREST AS SOON AS POSSIBLE FOR MISINTERPRETATION AND MISLEADING INFORMATION THAT WAS GIVEN TO ME.",
  "Settlement Amount" : "$53,397.09",
  "DisplayAAOLinkIfExists" : "N",
  "arbitrationClaimFiledDetail" : "",
  "arbitrationDocketNumber" : "",
  "Broker Comment" : "I WAS NAMED IN [CUSTOMER'S] STATEMENT, HOWEVER, THE COMPLAINT WAS AGAINST REP. [BROKER]. AT THE TIME I WAS A SALES MGR. [CUSTOMER] CALLED AFTER AGENT [BROKER] SOLD [CUSTOMER]. HE WAS CONCERNED THAT THE POLICY HE BOUGHT HAD THE NURSING HOME BENEFIT.  I TOLD HIM THAT HE PURCHASED A LIFE INS. CONTRACT THAT HAD THE LIVING NEEDS BENEFIT.  HE WAS NOT AWARE THAT HE HAD BOUGHT A LIFE INS. POLICY.  WHEN [CUSTOMER'S] POLICY WAS ISSUED IT WAS RATED.  HOWEVER, [BROKER] PLACED THE CONTRACT AS IS.  I THEN INFORMED THE GM, [BRANCH MANAGER] ABOUT WHAT [BROKER] DID.  [BRANCH MANAGER] THEN INTERVIEWED THE AGENT.  [BROKER] THEN WENT OUT AND REDUCED THE FACE AMOUNT.  TO THE BEST OF MY KNOWLEDGE, THE COMPLAINT CAME WHEN THE CLIENT GOT THE ANNUAL STATEMENT.  MY ONLY INVOLVEMENT WAS THAT I ANSWERED THE CALL FROM [CUSTOMER] AND TOLD HIM WHAT HE PURCHASED."
}

FINRA_EMPLOYMENT: THE PRUDENTIAL INSURANCE COMPANY OF AMERICA (680)
